The Union of Values is the second new party founded by a well -known person this year. Sahara was the first of the Wagenknecht alliance. With Maaßen's Union of Values and the emergence of BSW, many people said, "Is there a tendency towards the extreme parties?" he wonders. This scenario resulted in the creation of Auschwitz, the most hellish place of our world, and more than 44,000 concentration camps.

Yes. You read the figure correctly. 44,000. Among these camps were death camps: “The first camp opened in December 1941 was Chelmno, where Jews and novels were killed by gas in mobile gas minibuses.

With the Union of Values is a kind of “new DNVP” on the horizon, Germany seems to have become a part of the world's right -wing tendency in recent years. This means that Germany's great parties have lost a significant amount of voters.

This magic number was accompanied by the disintegration of the political landscape of Germany, and the political field filled with smaller and generally quite marginal parties that draw the discontent and ignorant from the mainstream parties. Maaßen and its Union of Values are another indication that these small parties have multiplied but not individually strengthened.

The Union of Values DNVP wants to participate in the state elections to be held in Thülingen, Saxony and Brandenburg in September this year. The registration periods for the European elections in June 2024 have already expired, so this time there is no such competition.

In the east, the party is likely to position the party on the right of the CDU, similar to the DNVP in the early 1930s. These 3 states will compete with AFD, BSW and many small local parties.

The Union of Values wants to show a smiling face as if it were CDU's willing partner. In the 1930s, Maaßen de Neo-Nazi AFD, who met Hitler's Nazi party, announced that he was “ready to meet” with AFD.

Maaßen's plan is to break voters from both parties and fill the gap between the conservative CDU and the Neo-Nazi Afd.

Maaßen lives in a political hallucination. The cliff between the non-progressive CDU and outright Neo-Nazi AFD, which he thinks are separated from the path of conservative values, is not a cliff. It is more like a small crack, maybe a fault line. Maaßen tells the public that AFD is a bit too radical.

For strategic reasons, Maaßen continues to see both the CDU and AFD as potential partners that will strengthen its political position.

The Union of Values aims to seize Germany's small bourgeoisie, conservatives, believers on the free market, national liberals, and even more ideological libertarians on the conservative side of Germany's classical social democrats (SPD). He also imagines that he can attract voters from the SPD's conservative wing, the Helmut Schmidt wing.

Ten years ago, this segment received support with Thilo Sarrazin's right -wing propaganda, which implied the Popular theme of the West, a popular theme of German reactionary thought since Oswald Spenger.

Maaßen's same-poisonous companions, the former Vice-Admiral Alexander Mitsch, Kay-Achim Schönbach (German militarism is never far from the combination of the extreme right) and former CDU deputy and former electric technician Albert Weiler represents all these various stances.

The draft of the establishment program of the Union of Values includes expressions in a very similar language in Neo-Nazi AFD's program. This is not something new either. In the 1930s, the DNVP had a similar language to Hitler's Nazi party. Historically, most of them are not new.

The Union of Values says, “We are in favor of the collapse of the party state and the expansion of popular sovereignty”. It is in favor of the introduction of plebicitarian elements such as referendum. Similarly, we want to give the right to vote against the laws agreed by the Parliament, Af says AFD. The current parliamentary democracy system will be eliminated or restricted.

Hans-Georg Maaßen, who moves from the same fascist game book with Trump, Putin and AFD, is the camp of Germany's progressive and environmentalists, despised and hated.

It positions as “left-green camp”. During the DNVP (1930s), the imaginary enemy was KPD.

Today, this location is occupied by Germany's environmental party Greens (we can tolerate capitalism). The Greens are passionately hated for advocating critical thinking by the Union of Values of CDU, Maaßen's reactionary wing, and further by Neo-Nazi AFD, and implements real programs that will benefit the environment.

Right -wing populists always need an enemy where they can demonize and ultimately kill without any conscientious intervention. This is not even a new thing. Nazi Party member Carl Schmitt - NSDAP Mitgliedsnummer: 2,098,860 - Since they advocated the completely destruction of the enemy, all right -wing authoritarians have included this belief in their canons.

Meanwhile, authoritarian Hans-Georg Maaßen continues to be a very controversial person. Although Maaßen acted as a traditionalist and introduced himself as the protector of Adenauer and Kohl's CDU, he is not aware of neither in the 1950s nor in the 1980s (Kohl).

What makes Maaßen a dangerous reaction is this call to a nostalgic past that has never happened. He wants to return the clock a few decades, maybe before 1945.

A light of hope is that a party, which is often decided by a few hundred and white men to its establishment, cannot cope with the difficulties of the modern election market.

Who would want an old agent that really fell out of sight to take over anything? Especially someone who has a fashioned cold war ideology that wants to live in the past. Without Tiktok and Youtube? MY GOD!

Unfortunately, things that once had real nightmares in election campaigns are dressed as pastoral dreams of their once -glorious past, dressing new glittering costumes. Nihilist authoritarian parties can never create positive plans for the future.

As Sex Pistols declared: There is no future under fascist regimes. The Maaßen and the Union of Values promises “a change of direction in almost all central policy areas ..

Behind this war, an authoritarian and harsh internal policy is hidden in a strict and reactionary social policy that makes little mercy on the weak. This is Hitler's “Volksgemeinschaft 2.0 ..

Of course, in order to stay in the same line with his friends on the right, this includes a very restrictive migration policy that should not even have compassion for minors. AFD had actually argued that the refugee was shot at the borders of Germany.

Pressure will also be made for the assimilation of immigrants. Either they adapt to our Volksgemeinschaft or they go away. The bell that AFD stole is playing a very similar bell. It is also colored with strong positions against Islam, even with real hostility towards religion and followers.

Avandland evokes the images of Abendland, which should be defended against non -bee. Here, too, the Union of Values is once again close to AFD. Almost an old speech of the DNVP of the 1930s or Hitler's Nazi party can be taken and the word “Jewish” can be changed with “Muslim ..

The people around Maaßen- and Maaßen has no real problems with Neo-Nazi Afd. Rather, there is a so -called “violent criticism öz for all positions to the left of the socialist, communist and Maaßen called“ extreme leftist ..

Maaßen's election strategy is that if AFD approaches the majority of parliament in the upcoming Eastern state elections, Maaßen's Union of Values (if they manage to enter any state parliament) will help AfD to come to power.

Just as DNVP was once Hitler's volunteer executioners, today there will be voluntary executioners that will carry Neo-Nazi Afd to power.

There are signs that there is a political gap between the conservative CDU and the Neo-Nazi Afd. Maaßen's reactionary values union is watered in the hope that they can fill this gap.

In September this year, the state elections to be held in Thuringen, Saxony and Brandenburg will show whether Maaßen's affordable attempt to establish a third political party on the far right of Germany will be successful.
